definition: Western learning (intellectual movement in the late Qing)/also called 洋務運動|洋务运动
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish

sentences.english: Helin, with a positive attitude welcomes the European and American are welcome to Western from the east.
sentences.chinese: 賀麟以積極的心態歡迎歐風美雨，歡迎西學東來。

sentences.english: Besides, he directed full attention to the training of people with Western learning.
sentences.chinese: 除了興辦近代工業外，容閎還十分注重培養西學人才。

sentences.english: The birth of modern biography literature in China is closely related to the introduction of western thoughts and the re-evaluation of Chinese tradition.
sentences.chinese: 現代傳記文學是在西學東漸審視傳統的基礎上誕生的。

sentences.english: What language is little Susie acquiring?
sentences.chinese: 小蘇西學到了什麼語言？

sentences.english: The historical background of Chinese literary theory is the introduction of Western modernity into China in the last few decades of the 20th century.
sentences.chinese: 20世紀晚期中國文論的歷史背景是現代性西學東漸。

sentences.english: They have cleverer hands, and they're quick to pick up new notions.
sentences.chinese: 它們的手更聰明，而且它們新東西學得很快。

sentences.english: Since the time of the West learning landing the East, Chinese learning has been confronted with the crisis of legitimacy.
sentences.chinese: 西學東漸以來，中國學術始終面臨着合法性危機。

sentences.english: All his social practices had something to do with his knowledge and quest for the western learning.
sentences.chinese: 穆藕初的所有社會實踐都與對西學的認識和探索有關。

definition: the New Culture Movement (mid-1910s and 1920s), intellectual revolution against Confucianism aiming to introduce Western elements, especially democracy and science
Self-Strengthening Movement (period of reforms in China c 1861-1894), also named 自強運動|自强运动
School of Mind/Neo-Confucian Idealistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Wang Yangming 王陽明|王阳明[Wang2 Yang2 ming2])

School of Principle/Neo-Confucian Rationalistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Cheng Hao 程顥|程颢[Cheng2 Hao4], Cheng Yi 程頤|程颐[Cheng2 Yi2] and Zhu Xi 朱熹[Zhu1 xi1])
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
